reviewText: Wow......I never knew that behind all that leather and heavy Steppenwolf rock and roll was a guy with such emotion and an abundance of brain cells. This is not what I expected from John Kay, but was certainly better than I was anticipating. First off, check out the half hour interview with John Kay in the "extras" part of the CD ....it was fantastic. Kay shares his incredible history, influences and also demonstrates what a deep thinking man he is. His appreciation of his mother, wife, friends and this great country he immigrated to are inspirational, and his insights certainly add depth and a greater appreciation for the fan when listening to his music. Ballads, bluegrass, and some rock from an aging rock star who has improved (like a fine wine).......John Kay actually has something to say to the listener and though I was expecting more of a hard rock album, I definately was not disappointed in this DVD. What a stud at 60 years old........great voice, great messages, great man. Though it's not hard rock like you might expect....... it's  better than you will expect. Take the time to listen to his interview too.........good stuff.P.S. That dude on the mouth harp is super too.
summary: It Ain't Steppenwolf, but Kay deserves our Respect

reviewText: im sorry about the previous REVIEW i had  a bad hair day.WHEN pam (we've loved her for so long do we need another name) steps on to the stage the show beginsand just keeps going. all the favorites and some new ones (shake the sugar tree;cleopatra;i said a prayerand my favorite river and the highway)all sang as only pam can.plenty of bonus material.a well made disc.if you like country music sang by a beautiful lady  this is for you .if not buy it anyway and ENJOY the cuz.

reviewText: This DVD Looks Like It Was Put Together In A School Auditorium, And The Band Was Given $2.50, The Production Is Awful, Dancers Picked Right Out Of The Audience.....Sad!  The Sound Is Terrible Not Powerful Enough. I Gave It 3 Stars because I Love Lynn Anderson and I Don't Think It Was Her Fault, Who Knows!... Next Time More Musicians, Better Production and Sound System, however,... I'm Glad I've Got the DVD Anyway!  Check Pictures Posted, D.D. Thank You
